description.p: Those who think of other planes at all consider them distant realms, but planar influence can be felt throughout the world. It sometimes manifests in beings who, through an accident of birth or the whim of a Genie, carry the power of the planes in their blood. Sorcerers of Genasi Bloodlines are one such people, the offspring of genies and mortals.

Occasionally, genasi sorcerers result from exposure to a surge of elemental power, through phenomena such as an eruption from the Inner Planes or a planar convergence. Elemental energy saturates any creatures in the area and might alter their nature enough that their offspring with other mortals are born as genasi.

div.p: I love the idea of player characters and NPCs with ties to the elemental planes, or as descendents of Genies. However, I never felt that genasi made sense as a player character race. To me, they always seemed like a type of sorcerer.

Much like the Draconic Bloodline Sorcerous Origin, I think switching genasi to a sorcerer subclass makes more sense in the grand scheme of things. A dwarven Stoneblood sorcerer or a human Emberheart sorcerer seemed more flavorful and fitting then just an earth genasi or a fire genasi. Especially considering the official lore from Wizards of the Coast for genasi in 5th edition.

description.p: As an Emberheart sorcerer, you have inherited the volatile mood and keen mind of the Efreeti. You tend toward impatience and making snap judgments. Rather than hide your distinctive appearance, you exult in it. Nearly all Emberheart sorcerers, also known as fire genasi, are feverishly hot as if burning inside, an impression reinforced by flaming red, coal- black, or ash-gray skin tones.
How does your flaming soul effect your decisions? Are you a raging inferno, unable to be controlled? Or, do you resist the urges of your bloodline, seeking to master your power?

Starting at 1st level, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Efreeti Magic table. The spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These spells can’t be replaced when you gain a level in this class.
At 1st level your Efreeti heritage grants you certain benefits. You are resistant to fire damage, and you have advantage on saving throws to resist being charmed or frightened.

Your blood is infused with the magic of elemental fire. You can speak, read, and write Primordial. This allows you to understand and be understood by those that speak it’s dialects: Aquan, Auran, Ignan, and Terran.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws to resist being charmed or frightened.

description.p: At 6th level your inner flame begins to burn more intensely. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals fire damage, the creature explodes outwards. Creatures within 10 ft. must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage based on the slain creature’s size. On a successful save they take no damage.
Small creatures deal 1d6 fire damage, and for each size category above small, the explosion deals an additional 1d6 damage. This ability has no effect on Tiny or smaller creatures.

description.p: At 18th level, your blood burns with the intensity of Elemental Fire. You no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep, and you are immune to fire damage. When you take damage from a creature within 60 ft. that you can see, you can use your reaction to rebuke them with Elemental Flame. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage equal to your sorcerer level.

description.p: As a Stoneblood Sorcerer, or earth genasi, you are a descendent of the cruel and greedy Dao. You have inherited some measure of control over earth, reveling in superior strength and solid power. Your blood calls you to avoid rash decisions, pausing to consider your options before acting.

Starting at 1st level, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Dao Magic table. The spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These spells can’t be replaced when you gain a sorcerer level.

As a descendant of the Dao you have inherited their tough skin and stalwart bodies. You hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class. Your skin becomes tough as stone. When you aren’t wearing armor your AC equals 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

Your blood is infused with the magic of elemental earth. You can speak, read, and write Primordial. This allows you to understand and be understood by those that speak it’s dialects: Aquan, Auran, Ignan, and Terran.

At 1st level your natural bond with all minerals and metals from the within the earth grant you an affinity for objets made from them. You gain proficiency with simple weapons, martial weapons, and shields.
Because of your connection with these metal objects, you can use your Constitution modifier for attack rolls with metal and stone weapons as long as you aren’t wearing any armor.

sheet.description: You can use your Constitution modifier for attack rolls with metal and stone weapons as long as you aren’t wearing any armor.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, when you hit a creature with a melee attack you can expend sorcery points to deal force damage to the target, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The extra damage is 1d10 for 2 sorcery points, plus 1d10 for each additional 2 sorcery points you spend, to a maximum of 6d10.
Additionally, you can use your Constitution modifier for damage rolls with metal and stone weapons as long as you aren’t wearing any armor.

description.p: At 14th level, your connection to the Elemental Plane of Earth deepens. As a bonus action, you expend 2 sorcery points and grant an aegis of protective earth magic to one allied creature you can see within 60 ft. The creature gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute, or until you use it again.

In addition, when a creature hits the protected target with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of the attacker and make a melee attack. You can teleport only if you and the attacker are on the same surface.

Additionally, when you use your Aegis of Stone to protect an ally, you can choose up to three creatures to gain its benefits.

description.p: As a Stormsoul Sorcerer, or air genasi, you are descended from the Djinni. As changeable as the weather, your moods shift from calm to wild and violent with little warning, but these storms rarely last long. Your blood drives you to be fleeting like the wind, never staying in one place for too long.

Starting at 1st level, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Djinni Magic table. The spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These can’t be replaced when you gain a sorcerer level.

You have inherited certain properties from your Djinni ancestry. Starting at 1st level, you are under the effects of the featherfall spell as long as you are conscious, and you can take the disengage action as a bonus action on your turn.

Your blood is infused with the magic of elemental air. You can speak, read, and write Primordial. This allows you to understand and be understood by those that speak it’s dialects: Aquan, Auran, Ignan, and Terran.

sheet.description: You are under the effects of the featherfall spell as long as you are conscious, and you can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on your turn.

description.p: Also at 1st level, channeling elemental power allows you to soar through the air, if only for a short duration. Any time you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, you gain a temporary flying speed for the remainder of your turn.
The flying speed granted by this ability is equal to your remaining movement speed. If you end your movement in the air you fall and take appropriate falling damage.

sheet.description: Any time you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, you gain a temporary flying speed equal to your remaining movement speed for the remainder of your turn. If you end your movement in the air you fall and take appropriate falling damage.

description.p: At 6th level, you gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, whenever you start casting a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, stormy magic erupts from you. This eruption causes creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 ft. of you to take lightning or thunder damage (choose each time this ability activates) equal to half your sorcerer level.

Additionally, your Djinni heritage allows you to subtly control the weather around you. If it is raining, you can use an action to cause the rain to stop falling in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on you. You can end this effect as a bonus action. If it is windy, you can use a bonus action each round to choose the direction that the wind blows in a 100-foot-radius sphere centered on you. The wind blows in that direction until the end of your next turn.

On a failed save, the attacker is pushed in a straight line 30 ft. from you.

description.p: The Primordial Sea, the Elemental Plane of Water, the source of all oceans, rivers, and lakes, and the home of the Marids. Without the life-giving effects of this plane there would be no rain, no water to help crops grow. But the great waters of the world are also dangerous; floods, hurricanes, and tidal waves strike with great and terrible power.

The lapping of waves, the spray of sea foam on the wind, the ocean depths—all of these things call to your heart. As a descendent of the noble collectors, the Marid, you exhibit their fierce independence, pride, and love of fine things.
Starting at 1st level, your Merid heritage fundamentally alters the nature of your body. You gain the following abilities:
You can breathe both air and water.
You have Darkvision out to 60 ft.
You gain a swim speed equal to your movement speed.
You ignore any of the drawbacks caused by a deep ocean environment.

Your blood is infused with the magic of elemental water. You can speak, read, and write Primordial. This allows you to understand and be understood by those that speak it’s dialects: Aquan, Auran, Ignan, and Terran.

sheet.description: You can breathe both air and water. You ignore any of the drawbacks caused by a deep ocean environment.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Merid Magic table. The spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These spells can’t be replaced when you gain a level in this class.

When you choose this origin at 1st level, you learn the secret of infusing your spells with the watery curse of the Merids. When you damage a creature with a spell that deals cold damage, forces them to move, or reduces their movement speed, you can choose to mark them with this curse. While the creature is cursed, anytime you deal cold damage, force a creature to move, or reduce the creature’s movement speed, the creature must make an additional Strength saving throw. On a failure, their movement speed is reduced to zero until the beginning of their next turn.

You can only have one creature under your curse at a time. If you choose to curse another creature, the curse immediately ends on the first creature. You can curse a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain all uses of this ability when you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 6th level, you gain the ability to defend yourself by momentarily assuming a watery form. When you are hit by an attack that deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage you can use your reaction to gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the beginning of your next turn. Then you can immediately move up to 30 ft. without provoking opportunity attacks.
You can use this ability a number of time equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain all uses of this ability when you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 14th level, your body has begun to become one with the Primordial Sea that you draw your power from. The power of your Watery Curse improves greatly. When you deal cold damage, force a creature to move, or reduce a creature’s movement speed, you can use your bonus action to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw instead of the normal Strength saving throw. On a failure they are restrained.

They can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns, on a success, they are no longer restrained. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the paralysis effect of your Watery Curse for the next 24 hours.

description.p: Once a generation the heads of the seven dwarven clans gather to select a new king. This process is lengthy and often takes years to reach a decision, but when the new king is selected he undergoes a secret ceremony, imbuing his soul with the divine blessing of rulership.

As a Runebrand sorcerer, you are destined to rule over dwarvenkind. You have been granted great power, but with that power comes responsibility. Will you live up to expectations and look to lead the dwarves into a new golden age?

When you are chosen to lead, you undergo the ancient dwarven ritual of kingship. At the end of this ritual a Divine Rune appears upon your brow signifying the type of ruler you have chosen become. At 1st level, select one of the Divine Runes below. It will be the source of your sorcerous power, and cannot be changed short of a wish spell or direct intervention from a deity.

Rune of Elegance. Your kingship will be marked by diplomacy and level headed judgment. You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill, if you have proficiency already you gain expertise, which means you add double your proficiency bonus to Persuasion checks.

Rune of Guile. Your kingship will be marked by cunning words and utilitarian politics. You gain proficiency in the Deception skill, if you have proficiency already you gain expertise, which means you add double your proficiency bonus to Deception checks.

Rune of Might. Your kingship will be marked by conquest and strength of arms. You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill, if you have proficiency already you gain expertise, which means you add double your proficiency bonus to Intimidation checks.

Your voice is imbued with power. Starting at 1st level, when you target a friendly creature with a spell of 1st-level or higher they gain (additional) temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier, in addition to the effects of the spell.

Additionally, you can cast command as a 1st-level spell, without expending any sorcery points. You can do this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 6th level your presence exudes confidence and nobility. As an action on your turn you can expend 3 sorcery points and speak a royal word of power, it’s effects determined by your Divine Rune.

Rune of Elegance. You utter a word of power that uplifts your allies. A number of friendly creatures equal to your Charisma modifier, within 30 ft., have advantage on their next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw before the beginning of your next turn.

Rune of Guile. You utter a word of power that confounds your foes. A number of enemy creatures equal to your Charisma modifier, within 30 ft., must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure they are charmed by you, and will do anything in their power to please you, until the beginning of your next turn.

Rune of Might. You utter a word of power that causes your enemies to quake with fear. A number of enemy creatures equal to your Charisma modifier, within 30 ft., must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure they are frightened of you, and will do anything in their power to avoid fighting you, until the beginning of your next turn.

description.p: By 18th level you have become a legendary figure of authority for your people and your deity has blessed you with increased divine power. You can cast the spell divine word without expending a spell slot. Once you use this ability you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

description.p: An alien influence has wrapped its tendrils around you, warping you in both body and mind. Perhaps a psychic splinter lodged in your psyche after you suffered domination by an aboleth. Maybe you were born somewhere tainted by the Far Realm, a planar blot that changed you forever. Or perhaps mind flayers kidnapped you, subjecting you to the nightmarish process of ceremorphosis — but the transformation failed and left you altered.

div.p: Psionics hold a unique spot in Dungeons & Dragons and is a critical part of one of the most iconic monsters; the Illithid. However, there has never been a satifying option for playing a fully-fledged psionic character in 5th edition.

With some adjustments, I believe the sorcerer class is the best way to bring this type of player character to life. To have the flavor fully match the mechanics of a psionic character, talk to your Dungeon Master about using the following optional rules (or use my Alternate Sorcerer).

ul.li:
Intelligence Spellcasting:
Change your saving throw proficiency, Spellcasting ability, Multiclassing prerequisites, and any other mentions of Charisma in the Sorcerer class description with Intelligence.

Psionic Origin Spells:
One of the main drawbacks of the sorcerer is the small amount of spells known. Adding a list of Origin Spells, flavorful & thematic spells that you automatically learn at certain levels, can go a long way to enhancing your psionic character.

Psionic Sorcery:
At 6th level, you gain the optional feature, Psionic Sorcery which lets you cast spells without V,S,M components.

Spell Point Casting Variant:
Use the Variant: Spell Points rule from page 288 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. Spell points allow for more flexibility for the caster, and better simulate psionic mental resources. Just make sure to limit the number of spells of 6th-level and higher you can cast per day.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Aberrant Magic table. The spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These can't be replaced when you gain a sorcerer level.

Starting at 1st level, your aberrant origin protects you from harm. Your body might have a coating of viscous slime, tough hide, scales, or an invisible psionic barrier (choose the form of protection when you gain this feature). Whatever form the protection takes, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier while you aren’t wearing armor.
Additionally, the aberrant influence causes your hit point maximum increase by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

sheet.description: When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals {{ac:aberrant resilience}}.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, when you cast a spell from your Aberrant Magic spell list, you can choose to cast it without any verbal, somatic, or material components.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. You regain all uses of this ability when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell from your Aberrant Magic spell list, you can choose to cast it without any verbal, somatic, or material components.

description.p: At 6th level, you gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, you can unleash the aberrant truth hidden within your flesh. As a bonus action, you can spend 2 or more sorcery points to transform your body for 1 hour. For each 2 sorcery points you spend, you can gain one of the following benefits of your choice, the effects of which last until the transformation ends:

ul.li: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and the ability to breathe water. Gills grow from your neck and your fingers become webbed.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. As you fly, your skin glistens with mucus.

Your body, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, becomes slimy and pliable. You can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing, and you can spend 5 ft. of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.
Your eyes turn black or become writhing sensory tendrils. You are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 60 ft. of you.

sheet.description: You can spend 2 or more sorcery points to transform your body for 1 hour. For each 2 sorcery points you spend, you can gain one of the listed benefits (your choice).

description.p: At 18th level, you become the focal point of a reality-warping anomaly. As an action, you can magically radiate a transparent, 20 ft. radius aura for 1 minute. Creatures of your choice treat the aura as difficult terrain, and when they start their turn in it, they take 2d10 psychic damage.

As a bonus action, you can end the aura early. If you do so, you and any number of creatures you choose within the aura are teleported to a location that you are familiar with, up to 1 mile away. Each creature must appear within 20 ft. of you and in an unoccupied space. Unwilling creatures must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure they are teleported.
Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

If you do so, you and any number of creatures you choose within the aura are teleported to a location that you are familiar with, up to 1 mile away. Each creature must appear within 20 ft. of you and in an unoccupied space. Unwilling creatures must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure they are teleported.

description.p: In order to master their power, mystics must first master themselves. They spend months and years in quiet contemplation, exploring their minds and leaving nothing uncovered. They typically live as hermits and shun society. A mystic who studied under a master worked as a virtual slave, toiling away at mundane tasks in return for the occasional lesson or cryptic insight.

When mystics finally master their power, they can use their mind to coerce their body into performing impressive physical feats. Mystics who become adventurers aren't content to remain hidden for long.

div.p: Psionics hold a unique spot in Dungeons & Dragons and is a critical part of one of the most iconic monsters; the Illithid. However, there has never been a satifying option for playing a fully-fledged psionic character in 5th edition.

With some adjustments, I believe the sorcerer class is the best way to bring this type of player character to life. To have the flavor fully match the mechanics of a psionic character, talk to your Dungeon Master about using the following optional rules (or use my Alternate Sorcerer).

Intelligence Spellcasting:
Change your saving throw proficiency, Spellcasting ability, Multiclassing prerequisites, and any other mentions of Charisma in the Sorcerer class description with Intelligence.

One of the main drawbacks of the sorcerer is the small amount of spells known. Adding a list of Origin Spells, flavorful & thematic spells that you automatically learn at certain levels, can go a long way to enhancing your psionic character.

Psionic Sorcery:
At 6th level, you gain the optional feature, Psionic Sorcery which lets you cast spells without V,S,M components.

Spell Point Casting Variant:

description.p: At 1st level, you have learned how to unlock the potential within your body. You gain proficiency in your choice of Acrobatics, Athletics, Perception, Sleight of Hand, or Stealth. At the end of a long rest, you can switch the proficiency you gained from this feature with another from the list.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in your choice of Acrobatics, Athletics, Perception, Sleight of Hand, or Stealth. At the end of a long rest, you can switch the proficiency you gained from this feature with another from the list.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Mystic Magic table. The spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know. These can't be replaced when you gain a sorcerer level.

At 6th level, you can channel psionic power into your body, honing your reflexes and agility to an incredible degree. As a bonus action, you can spend sorcery points to enhance yourself in one or more of the following ways.
Agile Defense. Spend 1 sorcery point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action.
Blur of Motion. Spend 2 sorcery points and cause yourself to be invisible during any of your movement until the end of your current turn.
Rapid Step. Spend up to 5 sorcery points. For each sorcery point you spend, your movement speed increases by 10 ft. until the end of your current turn.
Surge of Speed. Spend 2 sorcery points. Until the end of your current turn you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

sheet.description: You can spend sorcery points to enhance yourself in one or more of the following ways. Agile Defense (1 pt), Blur of Motion (2 pt), Rapid Step (<5 pt), Surge of Speed (2 pt).

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, when you cast a spell from your Mystic Magic spell list, you can choose to cast it without any verbal, somatic, or material components.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. You regain all uses of this ability when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell from your Mystic Magic spell list, you can choose to cast it without any verbal, somatic, or material components.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you can use your psionic abilities to become ethereal and move through solid objects. As a bonus action on your turn, you can choose to enter a semi-corporeal state. Any other equipment you are wearing or carrying transforms with you and becomes ethereal as well. While in this state you gain the following benefits.

ul.li: You can move through solid objects and creatures as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn inside an object you take 1d10 force damage. If you return to your normal form while inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, and you take 1d10 force damage for every 5 ft. traveled.
You are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.

description.p: This feature lasts for 1 minute, until you use a bonus action to end it, or you are incapacitated or die. Once you use this feature you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You can choose to enter a semi-corporeal state for up to 1 minute. Any other equipment you are wearing or carrying transforms with you and becomes ethereal as well. While in this state you can move through solid objects, you are resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

description.p: At 18th level, your mastery over your mind and body has reached utmost perfection. Your physical form is infused with the psionic energy. You no longer age, and you are immune to disease, poison damage, and the poisoned condition.

If you die, roll a d20. On a 10 or higher, you discorporate with 0 hit points instead of dying and fall unconscious. Your body disappears, and anything you are carrying falls to the ground. You appear at a spot of your choice on the plane of existence where you died, 1d4 days later, having gained the benefits of a long rest.

You appear at a spot of your choice on the plane of existence where you died, 1d4 days later, having gained the benefits of a long rest.

description.p: One day a light blazed forth within you, the illumination of psionic power. Your mind now simmers with this power, the full extent of which you won’t fully grasp for years to come. You can touch other minds with it and alter the world around you by using it to control the magical energy of the multiverse. Will this power shine from you as a hopeful beacon to others? Or will you be a source of terror to those who feel the stab of your mind and witness the strange manifestations of your might?

You learn that cantrip if you don't already know it, and it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer cantrips you know. You can cast the chosen cantrip as a bonus action with the modification listed below, requiring no verbal, somatic, or material components. You learn an additional cantrip from this list at 6th and 10th level.
friends. The target doesn't know it was charmed.
mage hand. The hand is invisible when you cast the spell, and controlling the spell is a bonus action for you.
message. You don't need to point toward the target or whisper your message out loud.

description.p: Starting at 18th level, you can spend 6 sorcery points as a bonus action to transform yourself into pure psionic energy. In this form, you have resistance to all damage except force and psychic damage, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.

If you end your turn inside an object you take 1d10 force damage. If you return to your normal form while inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, and you take 1d10 force damage for every 5 ft. traveled.
You remain in this form for 1 minute. It ends early if you are incapacitated, if you die, or dismiss it as a bonus action.

sheet.description: You can transform yourself into pure psionic energy for up to 1 minute. In this form, you have resistance to all damage except force and psychic damage, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.

description.p: You protect your mind with a wall of looping, repetitive thought. Until the start of your next turn, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and you have resistance to psychic damage.

setters.set: 1 reaction, when you are forced to make an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw

description.p: You drive a disorienting spike of psychic energy into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 psychic damage, and the first time it makes a saving throw before the end of your next turn, it must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the save.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach certain levels: 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You propel a lance of psionic disruption into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 3d6 psychic damage, and it can use its action only to Dash or Disengage on its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and this spell doesn't limit its action options.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

You unleash a destructive wave of mental power in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 5d8 force damage, is pushed 20 feet directly away from you, and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked prone.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.
